TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConversionJob extends Microsoft.Office.ConversionServices.Conversions.ConversionJob

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of file conversions (of single files or entire libraries) that share a common set of conversion properties and are logically tracked as a single unit.

Docs.param: A object that specifies which Word Services application proxy instance is associated with the object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified object.

remarks.para: The object is initialized with the default conversion job settings.

Docs.param: The user-defined friendly name for the object that services this object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the object specified by the parameter.

remarks.para: The parameter specifies the name of the Word Automation Services application as specified when the Word Automation Services application was created. You can see this name at any time through the Manage Service Applications page in Central Administration.

public: void AddFile(System::String ^ inputFile, System::String ^ outputFile);

Docs.param: The URL for the file to convert.ImportantThis URL must specify a location on the same SharePoint farm as the Word Automation Services application that performs the conversion job.
The URL for the conversion output location.ImportantThis URL must specify a location on the same SharePoint farm as the Word Automation Services application that performs the conversion job.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified input file to the set of conversion items in the conversion job, and places the result at the specified output file location.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddFolder (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFolder inputFolder, Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFolder outputFolder, bool recursion);

Public Sub AddFolder (inputFolder As SPFolder, outputFolder As SPFolder, recursion As Boolean)
public: void AddFolder(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPFolder ^ inputFolder, Microsoft::SharePoint::SPFolder ^ outputFolder, bool recursion);

Docs.param: An object that specifies the input folder for the conversion job.
An that specifies the output folder for the conversion job.

true to indicate that files in the subfolders of the specified input folder should also be converted; otherwise, false.NoteIf this flag is used, the directory structure is automatically recreated within the output folder.
Docs.summary: Converts the files in the specified input folder by using the conversion settings for the job, and places the results in the specified output folder location.

Docs.param: An object that specifies the input document library for the conversion job.
An that specifies the output document library for the conversion job.
Docs.summary: Converts the files in the specified document library by using the conversion settings for the job and places the output in the specified document library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Cancel ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Cancel() cil managed
Public Sub Cancel ()
public: void Cancel();

Docs.summary: Cancels a conversion job in progress.

remarks.para: When this method is executed, any conversion jobs in NotStarted or InProgress status are moved to Canceled status, and the status of the object is set such that it cannot be used to start any new conversions. Any conversions currently in progress complete as normal.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Canceled { get; }
.property instance bool Canceled
Public ReadOnly Property Canceled As Boolean
public: property bool Canceled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this conversion job has been canceled.
Docs.value: true if the conversion job has been canceled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Once a conversion job is canceled, no additional conversion requests can be sent to it.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void CancelJob (Microsoft.Office.Word.Server.Service.WordServiceApplicationProxy serviceApplicationProxy, Guid jobId, Nullable<Guid> subscriptionId);

Docs.param: A object that specifies which Word Services application proxy instance is associated with the object.
A structure that specifies the unique ID for the conversion job that you want to cancel.

A structure that specifies the partition ID of the tenant that created this conversion job. NoteIf the SharePoint farm is not configured for multiple tenants, pass a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) as the argument for this parameter.
Docs.summary: Cancels the specified conversion job.

.property instance valuetype System.Guid JobId
Public ReadOnly Property JobId As Guid
public: property Guid JobId { Guid get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that specifies the unique ID for this job.

remarks.para: This value is created whenever a conversion job is started. Use this property to query the conversion job queue.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Name { get; set; }
.property instance string Name
Public Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies a user-defined friendly name for this conversion job.

remarks.para: The specified name does not need to be unique across all conversion jobs.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Word.Server.Conversions.ConversionJobSettings Settings { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.Office.Word.Server.Conversions.ConversionJobSettings Settings
Public ReadOnly Property Settings As ConversionJobSettings
public: property Microsoft::Office::Word::Server::Conversions::ConversionJobSettings ^ Settings { Microsoft::Office::Word::Server::Conversions::ConversionJobSettings ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a object that specifies the settings applied to the input files in this conversion job.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Start ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Start() cil managed
Public Sub Start ()
public: void Start();

Docs.summary: Starts the processing of a conversion job.

remarks.para: Until this method is called, none of the conversion jobs specified by the , , or methods are pushed into the system.When this method is called, each conversion job is pushed into the Word Automation Services conversion job queue.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Started { get; }
.property instance bool Started
Public ReadOnly Property Started As Boolean
public: property bool Started { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this conversion job has been started.
Docs.value: true if the conversion job has been started; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property is set to true when the method is called. Once a conversion job is started, no additional conversion items can be added to it.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<Guid> SubscriptionId { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.Guid> SubscriptionId
Public Property SubscriptionId As Nullable(Of Guid)
public: property Nullable<Guid> SubscriptionId { Nullable<Guid> get(); void set(Nullable<Guid> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the partition ID of the tenant that created this conversion job.

remarks.para: This property is set whenever a object is created in a partitioned environment. If the SharePoint farm has not been configured to enable multiple tenants, this property will return a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.SPUserToken UserToken { get; set; }
.property instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPUserToken UserToken
Public Property UserToken As SPUserToken
public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::SPUserToken ^ UserToken { Microsoft::SharePoint::SPUserToken ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPUserToken ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the credentials under which this conversion job is executed.
Docs.value: An object. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

remarks.para: All attempts to read and write files in the SharePoint content database are made in the context of these credentials. The default value for this property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which is anonymous.
